ca.mcgill.ecse211.objectdetection

Class ObjectDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.objectdetection.ObjectDetection

  • public class ObjectDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class includes all the logic to locate objects and test them to see if they are flags
    Author:
    christophe

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObjectDetection(Driver driver, Odometer odometer, UltrasonicSensor usSensor, LightSensor lightSensor)
      Creates an ObjectDetection instance

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void findFlag()
      This method executes the flag finding logic and will return when the flag is found or all located objects have been tested.
      double[][] getObjectsLocation()
      Method that calculates the approximate location of surrounding objects based on the measurements in data
      boolean testObject()
      This method uses the horizontal light sensor to check if the object in front of the robot is the flag or not.
      void timedOut()
      Method that takes a distance measurement and adds it to the array

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectDetection

        public ObjectDetection(Driver driver,
                       Odometer odometer,
                       UltrasonicSensor usSensor,
                       LightSensor lightSensor)
        Creates an ObjectDetection instance
        Parameters:
        driver - a Driver instance that is the robot's driver object
        usSensor - a UltrasonicSensor instance
        odometer - a Odometer instance is the robot's Odometer
        lightSensor - a lightSensor instance is the robot's horizontal LightSensor

    • Method Detail

      • findFlag

        public void findFlag()
        This method executes the flag finding logic and will return when the flag is found or all located objects have been tested. It is to be called after the robot has crossed into enemy territory.

      • timedOut

        public void timedOut()
        Method that takes a distance measurement and adds it to the array

      • getObjectsLocation

        public double[][] getObjectsLocation()
        Method that calculates the approximate location of surrounding objects based on the measurements in data
        Returns:
        location a double[][] which is the approximate location of the object

      • testObject

        public boolean testObject()
        This method uses the horizontal light sensor to check if the object in front of the robot is the flag or not. It does not check whether or not an object is present in front of the robot.
        Returns:
        isObject a boolean which is true if the object detected is the flag, false otherwise
